result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda L Bartlett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**93 days jail credit, if revoked**

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: While incarcerated 25% of the inmate funds shall be applied to outstanding financial obligations.

superMiscConds.notes: AODA evaluation and comply as deemed necessary.

Counseling deemed necessary.

No contact with victims or residences.

Attorney Lambert makes statement and recommends 8 years WSP, 3 years ITC and 5 years ES.

Court sentences defendant to 8 years WSP, 3 years ITC and 5 years ES.

records.addlTxt: 10:38 Defendant Amanda L Bartlett in court with attorney D. Nicholas Carroll.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:00 Defendant Amanda L Bartlett in court with attorney D. Nicholas Carroll, who appears by phone.  Defendant Isaac R Hanneman in court with attorney Melissa Dalkert. Defendant Pandora L. Weir appears by phone means with attorney Karl Schmidt. Attorney Robert Gardner in court on behalf of Defendant David J Zabawa. Attorney John Bliss in court on behalf of Defendant Matthew J Gordon. Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Weir has filed a motion to sever.
Attorney Lambert agrees with motion except as to Defendant Zabawa.
Attorney Schmidt concurs, but objects that Defendant Weir's case be tried with Defendant Bartlett's cases.
Attorney Carroll states that his client, Defendant Bartlett will be entering a plea before trial.
Court grants Defendant Weir's motion to sever as to Defendant Hanneman and Defendant Gordon. Her case will be tried with Defendant Zabawa and Defendant Bartlett, if Defendant Bartlett wishes to have a trial. Defendants Hanneman and Gordon will be tried alone.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.
from D.Z. regarding bond
